entry.title: Possible Timeline For Australiaâ€™s Crypto Legislation Revealed
entry.summary:
For some folks, cryptocurrencies are complex and high-risk assets, which makes them hard to comprehend despite their potential. This limitation has posed challenges for several governments while seeking regulatory clarity for crypto. The same issue has been weighing on Australian authorities planning to release clear legislation for cryptocurrencies.
According to a new report, the Australian Treasury Department revealed a new timeline for crypto legislation in the country. The internal document noted that releasing Australiaâ€™s crypto legislation could extend beyond 2024, as the government wants to study the industry extensively before making decisions.
Decisions Regarding Australian Crypto Legislations Could Take Time
The Australian Financial Review obtained some documents under thâ€¦

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term â€œmetaverseâ€ in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel â€œSnow Crash.â€ Now heâ€™s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in â€œSnow Crash,â€ goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. entry.title: Terawulf Brings First Fully Nuclear-Powered Bitcoin Mining Operation In America Online
entry.summary: A joint venture with Cumulus Coin, LLC. has brought the first nuclear-powered Bitcoin mine online in Pennsylvania. Terawulf has announced roughly half of its nuclear-powered Nautilus Cryptomine has come online. The mining facility, a joint venture with Cumulus Coin, LLC., derives its energy wholly from the 2.5 GW Susquehanna nuclear generation station in Pennsylvania. The full operation will amount to 50 MW and 1.9 EH/s, with an option for Terawulf to add an additional 50 MW of bitcoin mining capacity, â€œwhich the Company plans to deploy in future phases,â€ according to a press release. Paul Prager, chairman and CEO of TeraWulf, said that â€œthe recent energization of the Nautilus facility earlier this month, approximately 16,000 of TeraWulfâ€™s owned miners, representing 1.9 EH/s of self-mining capacity, are onsite and being brought online daily.â€ â€œThe Nautilus nuclear-powered mining facility benefits from what is arguably the lowest cost power in the sector, just $0.02/kWh for a term of five years,â€ Prager commented. Mining consultant and cofounder of Citadel 256, Magdalena Gronowska, previously described in an article for Bitcoin Magazine how nuclear power can revolutionize Bitcoin mining. â€œNuclear is a carbon free, reliable and cheap energy source,â€ she told the magazine. â€œIt's not perfect in that it emits nuclear waste, but every energy source has tradeoffs between environmental footprint, reliability and capital and operating costsâ€¦ We need a diverse mix of energy generation, to serve both baseload and peak load, as we transition to a low carbon economy.â€

entry.title: While Bitcoinâ€™s Hashrate Remains Sky-High, Merge-Mined Crypto Asset Networks Benefit
entry.summary:
In recent times, Bitcoinâ€™s hashrate has been consistently above 300 exahash per second (EH/s) as multiple mining pools dedicate significant hashpower to the Bitcoin blockchain today. Interestingly, some of the worldâ€™s top bitcoin mining pools are also using their hashrate to merge-mine other coins, and these networks have benefited from bitcoinâ€™s increased hashrate.
How Bitcoinâ€™s Hashrate Benefits Other Crypto Networks
Bitcoinâ€™s hashrate secures the network and provides rewards for miners participating in the system, but mining pools also dedicate computational power to networks like Namecoin, Elastos, Emercoin, and Vcash. For example, Namecoin has a hashrate of around 187 EH/s today, and some of the top bitcoin mining pools merge-mine the network to acquire namecoin (NMC) rewards.
Mâ€¦

entry.title: Cutting Off Access To USD For Crypto Firms Is Deliberate, Matrixport
entry.summary:
Last week, news quickly circulated that Silvergate Bank, a crypto-friendly bank, was in hot water and had to stop offering USD services to its around 1,600 crypto customers. This obviously had a significant impact on the market as assets such as Bitcoin and Ethereum quickly lost a good portion of their gains from January. Even now, the market continues to feel the after-effects of the Silvergate announcement, but whatâ€™s even more shocking is the fact that the USD drought from crypto firms might be deliberate.
Is Halting USD Transfers Deliberate?
In a new report, Matrixport head of research Markus Thielen highlights recent developments in the crypto space when it comes to USD transfers. The first crypto platform to succumb was the Binance exchange which announced that it would no longerâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers: ETC Remains Near 2-Month Low, LTC Down by 4% on Monday
entry.summary:
Ethereum classic remained near a two-month low on March 6, as a cloud of uncertainty continued to hover over markets. The global crypto market cap remained bearish to start the week, and is down 0.55% at the time of writing. Litecoin also moved lower on Monday.
Ethereum Classic (ETC)
Ethereum classic (ETC) started the week trading close to a two-month low, as volatility in crypto markets remained high.
ETC/USD slipped to an intraday low of $19.26 on Monday, a day after trading at a peak of $20.05.
The move has pushed ethereum classic towards Fridayâ€™s bottom at $18.89, which was its weakest point since January 6.
Overall, todayâ€™s drop has seen ETC fall for a fifth consecutive session, down by over 8% in that period.
Prices are marginally higher than earlier lows, which comes as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) collided with a floor at 36.00
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 36.19, with the next visible floor at the 30.00 mark, in the event of a breakout.
Litecoin (LTC)
In addition to ethereum classic, litecoin (LTC) was another notable mover, as the token fell by as much as 4%.
Following a high of $91.27 on Sunday, LTC/USD dropped to a bottom at $87.15 during Mondayâ€™s session.
As a result of this move, litecoin moved closer to a floor at $86.00, which was last hit on Friday, and also a six-week low.
Recent declines in LTC have come following a downward crossover of the 10-day (red), and 25-day (blue) moving averages.
In addition to this, the RSI is now tracking at 40.47, which is marginally above support at 40.00.
Despite hovering beyond this floor, the index is at its weakest point since December 24 last year.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect litecoin to rebound in the coming days? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: At Northern Lightning 2023, Norway May Offer The Wildest Bitcoin Experience Yet
entry.summary:
Norway is putting on a major Bitcoin conference with high-signal speakers, topped off with an otherworldly rave running on Lightning. This is an opinion editorial by Erik Dale, an organizer of the upcoming Northern Lightning Conference and host of a Scandinavian Bitcoin podcast.
Source
Scandinavia may not be the first region that comes to mind when you think of Bitcoin, but tiny Norway has become the â€œbiggest bitcoin mining hub in Europe.â€ With less than 0.07% of world population, the Norwegians churn out nearly 3% of Bitcoinâ€™s global hash rate, mostly thanks to cheap, stranded and renewable hydropower in the north. And now, Norway is hosting the worldâ€™s â€œmost Bitcoin experienceâ€ (sic): Northern Lightning 2023. A Pure-Signal Conference Northernâ€¦

entry.title: Binance, Kuna Confirm Ukrainian Bank Cards Transaction Suspension In Hryvnia
entry.summary:
The Central Bank of Ukraine banned crypto transactions via bank cards to prevent its national currency, the hryvnia, from being used on crypto exchanges. Similarly, Binance and the countryâ€™s leading exchange Kuna have confirmed the suspension of crypto transactions via bank cards in Ukrainian hryvnia.Â
Following Ukraineâ€™s decision to temporarily stop hryvnia use on crypto platforms, it has become a critical issue for Ukrainian residents to withdraw from or move funds to another exchange.
Meanwhile, the worldâ€™s largest crypto exchange, Binance, suggested its community use peer-to-peer (P2P) trading solutions as an alternative option. It doesnâ€™t require any third-party counter, like banks, to trade with another user. This way, investors can continue their trading seamlessly.
Binanâ€¦

entry.title: Int'l Experiment Proposes Cross-Border Retail CBDC Run as Two Domestic Payments
entry.summary:
The Bank for International Settlement (BIS) and its partners, the central banks of Israel, Norway and Sweden have completed their joint experiment on cross-border retail central bank digital currency (CBDC). The experiment was tagged â€˜Project Icebreaker.â€™ Retail CBDC are government-backed digital currencies used for payment purposes by consumers and businesses.

The experiment, which studied the potential advantages and challenges of using retail CBDC in international payment, found that foreign exchange (FX) providers can be used to facilitate cross-border retail CBDC by breaking down a cross-border tâ€¦

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."

entry.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity
entry.summary: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movementâ€”until he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.

entry.title: Arianee CEO: Big Consumer Brands Are Going to Take Web3 to 1 Billion Users
entry.summary: Pierre-Nicolas Hurstel, CEO of Arianee, which offers enterprise software to consumer brands to help them launch NFTs tied to physical goods, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how much the NFT space is growing despite the bear market, how big consumer brands will take crypto mainstream, and how loyalty programs are going to be the next huge use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Salesforce Web3 Lead: Every Brand's Web Site Will Support Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Salesforce's Web3 lead Marc Mathieu sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the CRM giant's crypto strategy, why "we had to" embrace Web3, and why the crypto wallet is "the new cookie" online.

entry.title: Doodles CEO: Why In-Person Meetups Are Crucial for NFT Communities
entry.summary: Doodles CEO Julian Holguin, former president of Billboard, sat down with Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the strong vibes at the event and the importance of IRL meetups in Web3, what's next for Doodles and the community, and his prediction that many newer projects won't survive the crypto winter.

entry.title: SuperRare Co-Founder: We Remain Committed to NFT Artist Royalties
entry.summary: SuperRare co-founder Jon Perkins sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the debate over artist royalties, SuperRare's roots in catering to artists, and building through a bear market.

entry.title: gm: Meet the Brain Behind Avalanche
entry.summary: Avalanche founder and Ava Labs CEO Emin Gun Sirer has been working on proof-of-work cryptocurrencies since before Bitcoin (seriously). He talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about how Avalanche avoided FTX and how much damage SBF has done to cryptoâ€™s image with VCs, why institutions still arenâ€™t backing away from crypto, why Avalanche will succeed in the long run, and trying to cater to both Wall Street institutions and DeFi degens. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Founder of The Sandbox: 'Essential' to Metaverse That Users Own Their Digital Content
entry.summary: Sebastien Borget, founder and COO of the metaverse realm The Sandbox, sat down wit Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the future of the open metaverse and true digital ownership, what's next for The Sandbox, and its current user numbers and stats.

entry.title: Playboy's Next Step in Web3: MetaMansion in The Sandbox
entry.summary: Playboy's Web3 lead Liz Suman sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to tell the story of how the 70-year-old magazine brand got into Web3 and preview its upcoming MetaMansion in The Sandbox, which will give special access privileges to those with a Playboy Rabbitar NFT.

entry.title: Orange Comet CEO: 'We're Trying to Build the Disney of Web3'
entry.summary: Dave Broome, CEO of NFT design and production studio Orange Comet, spoke to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how his company takes "large, popular IP" and turns it into NFT content and Web3 worlds around it.

entry.title: Worldwide Web Founder: What NFT Gaming 'Should Be and Will Be'
entry.summary: Worldwide Webb is a gaming realm that lets you turn your NFT PFPs (Punks, Apes, Doodles and so on) into playable avatars. Founder Thomas Webb spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how the game works, the $10m Series A funding it just received, and why he expects we'll soon see NFT games that show what NFT gaming can do in its best form.

entry.title: Yat Siu of Animoca Brands: 'The Future of Crypto and Web3 Is Culture'
entry.summary: Animoca Brands chairman Yat Siu spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the open metaverse, NFTs and gaming, building through a bear market, and why Animoca believes the future of the industry is culture and gaming.

entry.title: COO of Move-to-Earn App STEPN: 'We're Thriving, Not Just Surviving'
entry.summary: Shiti Manghani, COO of Stepn, the app that lets users earn tokens for exercising, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about Stepn's current health, its plans to addnew achievement systems for the top users, and parent company Finding Satoshi Labs and its plans to launch more apps.

entry.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygonâ€™s Winning Streak
entry.summary: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industryâ€™s rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
